page.title: 15FARMING EPPERSTONE
page.content: Farming is mixed with some vegetables & soft fruit growing.Six farms over 150 acres grow wheat,barley & oilseed rape.One farm produces 4000 pigs p.a. Dairy units have modern milking parlours.Beef cattle are reared on 3 farms,at least one using intensive indoor methods.Farmworkers always include family members and range from 2-6 people.Spraying,harvesting & hedging are sometimes contracted out, but farms are highly mechanised. The County Council owns 3 small holdings each of 50 to 90 acres providing 1 dairy & 2 arable units. Land owned by Boots Co. research farm at Thurgarton is included in the area. Two farms operate within the village. One of 50 acres breeds racehorses & one 6 acre smallholding with a battery unit producing 200 eggs daily & rears beef cattle using intensive methods.
